modulegroup.name: Default/Base
modulegroup.description: The Default/Base package provies all the standard modules for articles and the sitemap-based navigation.

modules.module: A box module with one input field. Users can write either simple text or use HTML.
A box module with one input field. Users can write content using the richt text editor.
A box module with one input field. Users can write content using the richt text editor.
This box module makes it easy to use an image from the MediaDB as a background image.
Provides an image from the MediaDB with a configurable alt text and a headline.
Navigation box used to navigate through the pages that are contained in one level of the page tree.
Standard navigation box module
Sitemap page that displays a defined part of the page structure.

This module redirects any page requests to the URL defined in a link referring to internal or external resources. In addition, you can write a teaser for this link. The teaser and the link can be displayed using "Category with image" or "Tag Category".
This module just redirects any page requests to another defined page. The URL is changed when the page relocation takes place.
This page module provides a simple XHTML input field. Users can write either simple text or XHTML.
Topic with image is the standard article module with fields for title, subtitle, teaser, and article text, among others.

Category with image is the standard overview page. It contains the same standard fields like "Topic with image". In addition, it displays teasers of immediate subpages and a link to the corresponding article.
Just like "Category with image", this module will only display teaser and link of articles having a specific tag.
Topic with attached image gallery.
Category box - displays teasers and corresponding links like a category page.
This modules displays teaser and link of pages that have been tagged with a specific tag.
This module redirects any page requests internally to another predefined page. The browser isn't redirected explicitly, and the URL does not change.
This module is the standard output formatter using XSLT (ext/xslt, ext/xsl or ext/dom_xml).
This module creates an HTML link to another papaya page. The page link always includes the current page id which is passed to the target page.
This module creates an HTML link to another papaya page. The page link always includes the current page id which is passed to the target page. Users can enter text which is displayed around the link.
This box module displays page teasers with thumb images.
This box module displays page teasers with thumb images. Only those pages are selected that are linked with the tag selected by this module.
This page module displays boxes of a specified boxgroup as a grid.
An article page with error informations. This page has no teaser.
A connector with helper methods to handle data by pages.
Data filter used to list all taged tags from a page
